about.about_me: My name is Mohammad Khaki, a software engineer who was born in 1997 who has spent the last two years concentrating on innovative financial and software development projects. I am always considering new methods to enhance existing systems and have tried out a wide range of variations. Recently, I contributed to a paper that discussed the creation of a strategic model for investment in the market. If you need to get in touch with me, please use the email address down below.

article.title: Regression data analysis to forecast user rate based on Zomato restaurant features with random forest.
article.refrence: M. Khaki, F. Dehghani, Periodicals of Engineering and Natural Sciences, vol. 9, no. 2, pp. 774-783, 2022.
article.abstract:
As social networks have grown, they have generated much information that can be used to guide people's decisions. In this paper, we looked at different parts of restaurants and how they affected how customers rated them overall.
 It used restaurant data from Zomato to help users find their favorite restaurants in new cities. The analyses have been done on eight features of two groups: "quality and price" and "delivery." The restaurants use the random forest algorithm to score based on new and old data.
 The suggested method accurately ranked restaurants that have just opened with few users' comments. The model made here is 71% accurate when it comes to ranking.
 Additionally, this paper uses machine learning science to help restaurants improve their customer service by using this algorithm and paying more attention to the effective parameters here.
